title: Encountered errors `[...]` resolving bounds after type-checking [rustc 1.28.0-nightly (952f344cd 2018-05-18)]

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
When using shred-derive to `#[derive(SystemData)]`, I am encountering this error:

```
error: internal compiler error: librustc/traits/codegen/mod.rs:169: Encountered errors `[FulfillmentError(Obligation(predicate=Binder(TraitPredicate(<Thing as std::default::Default>)),depth=2),Unimplemented)]` resolving bounds after type-checking
```

Implementing `Default` for `Thing` does allow the program to compile.

I tried this code:

src/lib.rs:

```rust
extern crate specs;
extern crate shred;
#[macro_use] extern crate shred_derive;

use specs::prelude::*;

struct Thing;

#[derive(SystemData)]
struct Container<'a> {
    current_scene: Write<'a, Thing>,
}
```

Cargo.toml:

```toml
[package]
name = "test"
version = "0.1.0"

[lib]
name = "test"
path = "src/lib.rs"

[dependencies]
specs = "0.11"
shred = "0.7"
shred-derive = "0.5"
specs-derive = "0.2"
```

I expected to see this happen: Compile (or at least a compile error)

Instead, this happened: Compiler panicked!

## Meta

```
rustc 1.28.0-nightly (952f344cd 2018-05-18)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 952f344cdc0bca58d9f6c54dcfbae0890246e886
commit-date: 2018-05-18
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.28.0-nightly
LLVM version: 6.0
```
